A Song<S>7892</S> of degrees<S>4609</S>. When the LORD<S>3068</S> turned again<S>7725</S> the captivity<S>7870</S> of Zion<S>6726</S>, we were like them that dream<S>2492</S>. <sup>turned: Heb. returned the returning</sup>
Then was our mouth<S>6310</S> filled<S>4390</S> with laughter<S>7814</S>, and our tongue<S>3956</S> with singing<S>7440</S>: then said<S>559</S> they among the heathen<S>1471</S>, The LORD<S>3068</S> hath done<S>6213</S> great things<S>1431</S> for them. <sup>hath: Heb. hath magnified to do with them</sup>
The LORD<S>3068</S> hath done<S>6213</S> great things<S>1431</S> for us; whereof we are glad<S>8056</S>.
Turn again<S>7725</S> our captivity<S>7622</S> <S>7622</S>, O LORD<S>3068</S>, as the streams<S>650</S> in the south<S>5045</S>.
They that sow<S>2232</S> in tears<S>1832</S> shall reap<S>7114</S> in joy<S>7440</S>. <sup>joy: or, singing</sup>
He that goeth<S>3212</S> forth<S>1980</S> and weepeth<S>1058</S>, bearing<S>5375</S> precious<S>4901</S> seed<S>2233</S>, shall doubtless<S>935</S> come<S>935</S> again with rejoicing<S>7440</S>, bringing<S>5375</S> his sheaves<S>485</S> with him. <sup>precious: or, seed basket</sup>
